lines.text: A summer on Holland's canals leaves a marked impression... but a fall on its ice leaves a scar.
Tina, drudge of the Red Mill Tavern, had been "in Dutch" since birth.
Willem, the Tavern proprietor was a kind man... the mean kind.
It wasn't the dams but the damsels that had attracted Dennis Wheat to Holland.
Who wants a drink of milk?
May the devil and ghosts come and get you... you Spitzboop!
Help! The devil's got hold of my tail! Help! Momma! Poppa! Peter! Jacop! Herman! Uncle LOOO-OO-O-IE!
She's got a beautiful chassis!
Never mind the chassis! Wait till you see what she's got under the hood!
Dennis used to love me just like Jacop loves you... only worse.
Nobody could love anybody so worse as I love Jacop.
Jacop, I'm a lucky girl to be loved by such a handsome man as you.
My little glow-worm!
You're like a beautiful ray of sunshine standing there sunburning me.
I never believed in love at first sight until I took a second look at you.
Her lips are as sweet as virgin cherries that follow springtime blossoms!
How she could kiss! I could tell her lips from all others in the world!
Caesar, you'd better learn to walk with a bouquet. I think you're going to be a bridesmaid.
When a girl's as homely as Gretchen, Cupid can't shoot arrows... he's got to throw pocketbooks!
OOo! If only I could call you in English what I'm thinking in Dutch!
I'll make you loosen your tongue!
Just as my Jacop was beginning to commence a mouse jumped in my shoe!
Always something happens just when my little Jacop begins to commence.
